meanings.definition: The illegal distillation and distribution of liquor, typically done at night to avoid detection.
meanings.sent1: Moonshining can lead to serious legal trouble.
meanings.sent2: Moonshining in the woods is a risky business.
meanings.sent3: The sheriff caught the moonshining operation red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The moonshining business thrived under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The dangers of moonshining were well-known in the small town.

meanings.sent1: The moonshining process requires skill and secrecy.
meanings.sent2: Moonshining was a common practice during Prohibition.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's moonshining hobby always made the family gatherings interesting.
meanings.sent4: The art of moonshining has been passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The smell of moonshining lingered in the old barn.

meanings.definition: To engage in the production of moonshine.
meanings.sent1: He decided to start moonshining after losing his job.
meanings.sent2: Moonshining was a way for some to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors joked that he was moonshining in his backyard.
meanings.sent4: She was caught moonshining by the authorities.
meanings.sent5: Moonshining under the stars felt like a rebellious act.
